department.dept_long_name: Department of East Asian Languages and Civilizations

course.title: Research Methods in Late Imperial Chinese History I: Seminar
course.faculty_text: Mark C. Elliott and Michael A. Szonyi
course.description: Training in the use of a wide array of sources, methods, and reference tools for research in the history of late imperial China, focusing upon the reading and analysis of different types of Qing-era documents, official and unofficial. Students will write a research paper using documents provided in class. Reading knowledge of modern and literary Chinese required.
course.prerequisites: Chinese 106b or equivalent in foundation literary Chinese.
course.notes: Open to qualified undergraduates with permission of instructor.
